mark_primary.instruction: First, let's identify the core fields. For each of the following, draw a box on the image.

tools.label: Record Date
tools.help: The record date can generally be found in the upper left hand corner of the record. If multiple dates appear, draw a box around each.

tools.label: Record Number
tools.help: The record number can generally be found in the upper right hand corner of the record.

mark_secondary.instruction: Great! Now, click on the image to place a marker next to each of the following.

tools.label: Mortgager Name
tools.help: The mortgager name is often found at the top of the list of hand-entered data in the bottom half of the records. The mortgager tends to be a single personâ€™s name. If multiple names are provided, draw the box around all of them.

tools.label: Street Address
tools.help: The street address is often found at the top of the list of hand-entered data in the bottom half of the records.

tools.label: Amount Loaned
tools.help: The Amount Loaned is typically found at or near the bottom of the record. For example, for "Amount Loaned: $4,500."

mark_valuation.instruction: Great! Draw a box around the valuation dates. Valuations occur toward the bottom of the form and include an assessment date and dollar value. If there are multiple valuations, draw the box around all of them.
